seo.title: Przewodnik po Positano
seo.description: Pełen przegląd: dojazd, noclegi, jedzenie, plaże i praktyczne wskazówki dla odwiedzających.

sections.title: When to visit
body: Shoulder months (April–May, late September–October) balance weather and prices.
Summer brings ferries and long days but also heat and queues — start early.

sections.title: Getting around
body: Walk, SITA buses, and seasonal ferries cover most routes; stairs are common.
Use our public transport guide for tickets, timing, and crowd‑dodging tips.

sections.title: Highlights
body: Spiaggia Grande and Fornillo beaches; sunset viewpoints above Via Pasitea.

sections.title: Where to stay
body: Stay near ‘Chiesa Nuova’ or ‘Sponda’ bus stops to minimise stairs with luggage.

items.caption: Sunset from the terrace — stay steps from the Chiesa Nuova bus stop.
Fornillo and Spiaggia Grande are walkable; expect stairs.

whereToStay.title: Where to stay
whereToStay.body: Staying near Chiesa Nuova means fewer stairs on arrival and departure. Hostel Brikette is ~80 m from the bus stop with panoramic terraces and affordable beds and private rooms. Beachfront stays near Spiaggia Grande are scenic but come with more stairs and higher prices.

thingsToDo.title: Things to do
thingsToDo.beaches: <linkBeaches>Beaches</linkBeaches>: Spiaggia Grande for the classic view; Fornillo for a quieter vibe; Arienzo for a scenic cliffside swim.

moneySavers.title: Money savers
moneySavers.travel: Travel outside peak weekends; compare <linkBudgetArrival>budget arrival options</linkBudgetArrival>.

faqs.question: Is Positano doable on a budget?
faqs.answer: Yes. Use buses, plan ferries selectively, and focus on free viewpoints and beach time.
